subject: Sleep
title: Sleep Potions Through the Ages
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Sleep Potions Through the Ages.

hook.text: For centuries, people drank opium, alcohol, and herbal concoctions to sleep. Some of them were deadly.

buildup.text: Ancient Romans used mandrake root, Egyptians used opium poppy, and medieval Europeans used henbane.

discovery.text: Laudanum, an opium-alcohol mix, was widely sold as a sleep remedy in the 1800s with no regulation.

twist.text: Chloral hydrate, the first synthetic sleeping pill, appeared in 1869. It was also used to make knockout drops.

climax.text: Every era has sought chemical sleep solutions. The ingredients change but the desperation remains the same.

punchline.text: Humans have been drugging themselves to sleep for thousands of years.

quiz.question: What was laudanum?
options: An opium and alcohol mixture sold as a sleep remedy
